trans-unit.source: Page 3
trans-unit.target: Page 3

trans-unit.source: Introducing MateCat
trans-unit.target: Introducing MateCat

trans-unit.source: MateCat is an open source, enterprise-level, web-based translation software which closely integrates machine translation and human translation.
trans-unit.target: MateCat is an open source, enterprise-level, web-based translation software which closely integrates machine translation and human translation.

trans-unit.source: Using MateCat, you obtain between 10% and 20% more matches for your translations thanks to the largest public translation memory in the world and the best machine translation currently in use.
trans-unit.target: Using MateCat, you obtain between 10% and 20% more matches for your translations thanks to the largest public translation memory in the world and the best machine translation currently in use.

trans-unit.source: How MateCat Calculates Payable Words
trans-unit.target: How MateCat Calculates Payable Words

trans-unit.source: MateCat counts words by using a {1>combination <1}{2>of advanced <2}{3>TM technology <3}(MyMemory) and application of a reduction in weighting {4>for machine translation suggestions<4}.
trans-unit.target: MateCat counts words by using a {1>combination <1}{2>of advanced <2}{3>TM technology <3}(MyMemory) and application of a reduction in weighting {4>for machine translation suggestions<4}.

trans-unit.source: This allows MateCat to give you {5>more matches <5}{6>than any other translation tool.<6}
trans-unit.target: This allows MateCat to give you {5>more matches <5}{6>than any other translation tool.<6}

trans-unit.source: According to industry standards, words or phrases with a 100% Translation Memory match are given a weighting of 30% and words or phrases with a partial TM match are given a weighting of 60%.
trans-unit.target: According to industry standards, words or phrases with a 100% Translation Memory match are given a weighting of 30% and words or phrases with a partial TM match are given a weighting of 60%.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example to calculate weighted words{1>1<1}{2>:<2}
trans-unit.target: Here is an example to calculate weighted words{1>1<1}{2>:<2}

trans-unit.source: No TM match = Lower fuzzy ranges = Higher fuzzy ranges = 100% match =
trans-unit.target: No TM match = Lower fuzzy ranges = Higher fuzzy ranges = 100% match =

trans-unit.source: Repetition (same segment repeated in the document) = Context match (more than 100% match, because of same context information in the TM) =
trans-unit.target: Repetition (same segment repeated in the document) = Context match (more than 100% match, because of same context information in the TM) =

trans-unit.source: 1 {1>This is an example.<1}
trans-unit.target: 1 {1>This is an example.<1}

trans-unit.source: {1>Each CAT tool counts words differently and each LSP calculates weighted words differently.<1}
trans-unit.target: {1>Each CAT tool counts words differently and each LSP calculates weighted words differently.<1}

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 4
trans-unit.target: Page 4

trans-unit.source: MateCat counts matches according to these standards.
trans-unit.target: MateCat counts matches according to these standards.

trans-unit.source: For Machine Translation, MateCat decides which reduction in weighting to apply on the basis of the extent to which the {1>MT <1}has been useful for the past 1 million words for each language combination.
trans-unit.target: For Machine Translation, MateCat decides which reduction in weighting to apply on the basis of the extent to which the {1>MT <1}has been useful for the past 1 million words for each language combination.

trans-unit.source: MateCat assumes that the less the machine translation suggestion is edited by translators, the more useful it is.
trans-unit.target: MateCat assumes that the less the machine translation suggestion is edited by translators, the more useful it is.

trans-unit.source: We decided to {1>split the benefits of this technology <1}{2>between the language service provider and the translator.<2}
trans-unit.target: We decided to {1>split the benefits of this technology <1}{2>between the language service provider and the translator.<2}

trans-unit.source: {2>So, if a translator saves 20% of his/her time, the word count is reduced by 10% only.<2}
trans-unit.target: {2>So, if a translator saves 20% of his/her time, the word count is reduced by 10% only.<2}

trans-unit.source: {1>How MateCat counts <1}{2>payable words <2}in a project is indicated in the volume analysis {3>report<3} generated during {4>creation of the project<4} itself.
trans-unit.target: {1>How MateCat counts <1}{2>payable words <2}in a project is indicated in the volume analysis {3>report<3} generated during {4>creation of the project<4} itself.

trans-unit.source: Volume Analysis Page
trans-unit.target: Volume Analysis Page

trans-unit.source: The volume analysis page which opens during the creation of a project in MateCat shows you a global {1>report <1}{2>of the volume <2}to be translated:
trans-unit.target: The volume analysis page which opens during the creation of a project in MateCat shows you a global {1>report <1}{2>of the volume <2}to be translated:

trans-unit.source: {1>Standard weighted words<1}:
trans-unit.target: {1>Standard weighted words<1}:

trans-unit.source: The volume as calculated by {2>industry standard CAT tools.<2}
trans-unit.target: The volume as calculated by {2>industry standard CAT tools.<2}

trans-unit.source: Calculation of the weighted word count takes into consideration repetitions and TM matches.
trans-unit.target: Calculation of the weighted word count takes into consideration repetitions and TM matches.

trans-unit.source: {1>MateCat weighted words<1}:
trans-unit.target: {1>MateCat weighted words<1}:

trans-unit.source: The {2>MateCat word count<2} which not only counts repetitions and TM matches, but also generates reductions in weightings for internal matches and MT suggestions.
trans-unit.target: The {2>MateCat word count<2} which not only counts repetitions and TM matches, but also generates reductions in weightings for internal matches and MT suggestions.

trans-unit.source: {1>Raw words<1}:
trans-unit.target: {1>Raw words<1}:

trans-unit.source: The word count without any reduction in weighting for repetitions or matches.
trans-unit.target: The word count without any reduction in weighting for repetitions or matches.

trans-unit.source: For each language pair, you will find the details of the analysis.
trans-unit.target: For each language pair, you will find the details of the analysis.

trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 5
trans-unit.target: Page 5

trans-unit.source: {1}{2>In case of <2}{3>multiple language pairs<3}{4>, this global report shows you the total project volume.<4}
trans-unit.target: {1}{2>In case of <2}{3>multiple language pairs<3}{4>, this global report shows you the total project volume.<4}

trans-unit.source: Supported browser, languages and formats
trans-unit.target: Supported browser, languages and formats

trans-unit.source: All you need to use to start working with MateCat is an up-to-date version of a supported web browser:
trans-unit.target: All you need to use to start working with MateCat is an up-to-date version of a supported web browser:

trans-unit.source: • {1>Google Chrome <1}{2>30, or higher (on Windows, Linux and Mac OS X) <2}• {3>Safari <3}{4>5.1.7, or higher (on Mac OS X)<4}
trans-unit.target: • {1>Google Chrome <1}{2>30, or higher (on Windows, Linux and Mac OS X) <2}• {3>Safari <3}{4>5.1.7, or higher (on Mac OS X)<4}

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 6
trans-unit.target: Page 6

trans-unit.source: MateCat supports {1>79 languages, <1}works with many language combinations, and supports {2>56 file formats<2}.
trans-unit.target: MateCat supports {1>79 languages, <1}works with many language combinations, and supports {2>56 file formats<2}.

trans-unit.source: Here is the list of supported languages and file formats:
trans-unit.target: Here is the list of supported languages and file formats:

trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 8
trans-unit.target: Page 8

trans-unit.source: Translation Process
trans-unit.target: Translation Process

trans-unit.source: The translation process is divided into the following phases:
trans-unit.target: The translation process is divided into the following phases:

trans-unit.source: {1>Creating a project<1}: from the MateCat home page {2>{3>(<3}{4>http://www.matecat.com)<4}<2} you can select the {5>source and target language(s) <5}and add the file(s) to translate.
trans-unit.target: {1>Creating a project<1}: from the MateCat home page {2>{3>(<3}{4>http://www.matecat.com)<4}<2} you can select the {5>source and target language(s) <5}and add the file(s) to translate.

trans-unit.source: Then you can choose one of the following options:
trans-unit.target: Then you can choose one of the following options:

trans-unit.source: {1>o<1}use a {2>machine translation server<2}{3> of your choice.<3}
trans-unit.target: {1>o<1}use a {2>machine translation server<2}{3> of your choice.<3}

trans-unit.source: {3>This option allows you to receive <3}{4>machine translation suggestions <4}for each segment from the server you choose.
trans-unit.target: {3>This option allows you to receive <3}{4>machine translation suggestions <4}for each segment from the server you choose.

trans-unit.source: You can disable this option by selecting {5>NONE <5}{6>from the dropdown menu.<6}
trans-unit.target: You can disable this option by selecting {5>NONE <5}{6>from the dropdown menu.<6}

trans-unit.source: o associate an existing or new {1>private TM<1}.
trans-unit.target: o associate an existing or new {1>private TM<1}.

trans-unit.source: By associating a private TM, you will be able to store all the translated segments in this private translation memory and {2>add new glossary items<2}{3> if necessary.<3}
trans-unit.target: By associating a private TM, you will be able to store all the translated segments in this private translation memory and {2>add new glossary items<2}{3> if necessary.<3}

trans-unit.source: {3>In this way, you will be able use this private TM for future projects and take advantage of already translated segments.<3}
trans-unit.target: {3>In this way, you will be able use this private TM for future projects and take advantage of already translated segments.<3}

trans-unit.source: o do {1>without any private TM<1}.
trans-unit.target: o do {1>without any private TM<1}.

trans-unit.source: In this way, you will receive suggestions and store your translation in a {2>public TM exclusively for MateCat users<2}{3>.<3}
trans-unit.target: In this way, you will receive suggestions and store your translation in a {2>public TM exclusively for MateCat users<2}{3>.<3}

trans-unit.source: If you choose to receive suggestions from both the MT and the TM, you can receive from 10 to 20% more matches for all your translations.
trans-unit.target: If you choose to receive suggestions from both the MT and the TM, you can receive from 10 to 20% more matches for all your translations.

trans-unit.source: This can increase your productivity and enable you to work more quickly.
trans-unit.target: This can increase your productivity and enable you to work more quickly.

trans-unit.source: {1>Translating<1}: the {2>Translation Editor<2}{3> window shows the translation interface.<3}
trans-unit.target: {1>Translating<1}: the {2>Translation Editor<2}{3> window shows the translation interface.<3}

trans-unit.source: {3>It has 2 columns: source text in the left column and translated text in the right column.<3}
trans-unit.target: {3>It has 2 columns: source text in the left column and translated text in the right column.<3}

trans-unit.source: {3>When you open a segment during your translation, MateCat searches for <3}{4>matches from translation memories<4}{5>2 <5}{6>and from machine translations<6}, if
trans-unit.target: {3>When you open a segment during your translation, MateCat searches for <3}{4>matches from translation memories<4}{5>2 <5}{6>and from machine translations<6}, if

trans-unit.source: 2 {1>Both your private TM, if any, and the public shared translation memory.<1}
trans-unit.target: 2 {1>Both your private TM, if any, and the public shared translation memory.<1}

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 9
trans-unit.target: Page 9

trans-unit.source: enabled.
trans-unit.target: enabled.

trans-unit.source: During the translation, MateCat also automatically performs some {1>quality checks<1}{2> on Tag mismatches, Tag order mismatches, Whitespace mismatches and translation conflicts.<2}
trans-unit.target: During the translation, MateCat also automatically performs some {1>quality checks<1}{2> on Tag mismatches, Tag order mismatches, Whitespace mismatches and translation conflicts.<2}

trans-unit.source: {1>Finalising a project<1}:
trans-unit.target: {1>Finalising a project<1}:

trans-unit.source: A {2>progress bar<2} at the bottom of the Translation Editor window shows the progress of your translation.
trans-unit.target: A {2>progress bar<2} at the bottom of the Translation Editor window shows the progress of your translation.

trans-unit.source: The translation is finished when the progress bar is at {3>100% complete<3}, when there are no {4>To-do <4}words
trans-unit.target: The translation is finished when the progress bar is at {3>100% complete<3}, when there are no {4>To-do <4}words

trans-unit.source: {1}{2>left and when <2}{3>no errors are reported in the QA module<3}
trans-unit.target: {1}{2>left and when <2}{3>no errors are reported in the QA module<3}

trans-unit.source: {4>When the translation is complete and all issues have been fixed, you can click on the <4}{5>Download translation <5}{6>button to download the translated file in the original format.<6}
trans-unit.target: {4>When the translation is complete and all issues have been fixed, you can click on the <4}{5>Download translation <5}{6>button to download the translated file in the original format.<6}

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 10
trans-unit.target: Page 10

trans-unit.source: Start working with MateCat
trans-unit.target: Start working with MateCat

trans-unit.source: MateCat Home Page and Login
trans-unit.target: MateCat Home Page and Login

trans-unit.source: There are currently two versions of the MateCat translation tool:
trans-unit.target: There are currently two versions of the MateCat translation tool:

trans-unit.source: • {1>http://demo.matecat<1}{2>.com <2}{3>– Open source version to translate XLIFF files.<3}
trans-unit.target: • {1>http://demo.matecat<1}{2>.com <2}{3>– Open source version to translate XLIFF files.<3}

trans-unit.source: {3>The user can also install and administer the open source version on his/her own server.<3}
trans-unit.target: {3>The user can also install and administer the open source version on his/her own server.<3}

trans-unit.source: {3>For further instructions and details, refer to the <3}{4>{5>installation guide<5}{6>.<6}<4}
trans-unit.target: {3>For further instructions and details, refer to the <3}{4>{5>installation guide<5}{6>.<6}<4}

trans-unit.source: {1>• <1}{2>http://www.matecat.com <2}– Proprietary version which includes filters for {3>56<3} {4>file formats<4}{5>.<5}
trans-unit.target: {1>• <1}{2>http://www.matecat.com <2}– Proprietary version which includes filters for {3>56<3} {4>file formats<4}{5>.<5}

trans-unit.source: {6>This is the version we use as a reference for this user manual.<6}
trans-unit.target: {6>This is the version we use as a reference for this user manual.<6}

trans-unit.source: This version of MateCat is free for both personal and business translation jobs.
trans-unit.target: This version of MateCat is free for both personal and business translation jobs.

trans-unit.source: {1>In order to store and recover your projects in MateCat, you should <1}{2>log in <2}by clicking on the {3>login <3}button at the bottom of the MateCat home page.
trans-unit.target: {1>In order to store and recover your projects in MateCat, you should <1}{2>log in <2}by clicking on the {3>login <3}button at the bottom of the MateCat home page.

trans-unit.source: You will be asked to sign in using your {4>Google account<4}.
trans-unit.target: You will be asked to sign in using your {4>Google account<4}.

trans-unit.source: Creating Projects
trans-unit.target: Creating Projects

trans-unit.source: {1>In MateCat, translation jobs are organised into <1}{2>projects<2}.
trans-unit.target: {1>In MateCat, translation jobs are organised into <1}{2>projects<2}.

trans-unit.source: A project is made up of one or more translation {3>jobs <3}and each one is associated with a unique {4>job URL.<4}
trans-unit.target: A project is made up of one or more translation {3>jobs <3}and each one is associated with a unique {4>job URL.<4}

trans-unit.source: Each project can be created with one source language and {5>one or more target languages<5}.
trans-unit.target: Each project can be created with one source language and {5>one or more target languages<5}.

trans-unit.source: {1>To create a new project in MateCat, visit <1}{2>{u>http://www.matecat.com<u}<2}
trans-unit.target: {1>To create a new project in MateCat, visit <1}{2>{u>http://www.matecat.com<u}<2}

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 11
trans-unit.target: Page 11

trans-unit.source: All you need to do is select the language combination and upload the file(s) to translate.
trans-unit.target: All you need to do is select the language combination and upload the file(s) to translate.

trans-unit.source: This is necessary to create your project.
trans-unit.target: This is necessary to create your project.

trans-unit.source: By clicking on {1>Options<1}{2>, you can add options or change preferential options.<2}
trans-unit.target: By clicking on {1>Options<1}{2>, you can add options or change preferential options.<2}

trans-unit.source: If you need to store your project and recover it later, you should firstly {1>log in<1}{2> using the <2}{3>Login <3}{4>button at the bottom of the page.<4}
trans-unit.target: If you need to store your project and recover it later, you should firstly {1>log in<1}{2> using the <2}{3>Login <3}{4>button at the bottom of the page.<4}

trans-unit.source: {4>This allows you to add all your projects to your Management Panel, recover all information about projects, such as the <4}{5>volume analysis<5}{6> or job URL, and check the progress of translations.<6}
trans-unit.target: {4>This allows you to add all your projects to your Management Panel, recover all information about projects, such as the <4}{5>volume analysis<5}{6> or job URL, and check the progress of translations.<6}

trans-unit.source: {1}Note: it is not possible to work on MateCat offline.
trans-unit.target: {1}Note: it is not possible to work on MateCat offline.

trans-unit.source: You can only save your translation and receive suggestions from the MT(s) and TM(s) if you work online.
trans-unit.target: You can only save your translation and receive suggestions from the MT(s) and TM(s) if you work online.

trans-unit.source: How To Upload File(s) for Translation
trans-unit.target: How To Upload File(s) for Translation

trans-unit.source: Always remember to choose the {1>language combination(s) <1}{2>of your project before uploading the file(s) to translate, otherwise you will be asked to upload the file(s) again and the following message will be displayed:<2}
trans-unit.target: Always remember to choose the {1>language combination(s) <1}{2>of your project before uploading the file(s) to translate, otherwise you will be asked to upload the file(s) again and the following message will be displayed:<2}

trans-unit.source: {1}{2>If you need to select <2}{3>more than one target language<3}{4>, please use the <4}{5>Multiple languages?<5}{6> link.<6}
trans-unit.target: {1}{2>If you need to select <2}{3>more than one target language<3}{4>, please use the <4}{5>Multiple languages?<5}{6> link.<6}

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 12
trans-unit.target: Page 12

trans-unit.source: {1}{2>A box with the list of all <2}{3>supported languages<3}{4> will be displayed.<4}
trans-unit.target: {1}{2>A box with the list of all <2}{3>supported languages<3}{4> will be displayed.<4}

trans-unit.source: {4>Check the boxes of all languages you need to translate into, as shown in the screenshot below:<4}
trans-unit.target: {4>Check the boxes of all languages you need to translate into, as shown in the screenshot below:<4}

trans-unit.source: In order to upload the file(s) for translation you can:
trans-unit.target: In order to upload the file(s) for translation you can:

trans-unit.source: {1>• <1}directly {2>drag and drop <2}them or
trans-unit.target: {1>• <1}directly {2>drag and drop <2}them or

trans-unit.source: {1>• <1}{2>browse <2}for them by clicking on the {3>+ Add files… <3}button.
trans-unit.target: {1>• <1}{2>browse <2}for them by clicking on the {3>+ Add files… <3}button.

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 13
trans-unit.target: Page 13

trans-unit.source: {1}{2>MateCat automatically <2}{3>checks the source language <3}{4>of your documents to make sure that it matches the one you selected.<4}
trans-unit.target: {1}{2>MateCat automatically <2}{3>checks the source language <3}{4>of your documents to make sure that it matches the one you selected.<4}

trans-unit.source: {4>Otherwise, a warning message is displayed as in the screenshot below<4}
trans-unit.target: {4>Otherwise, a warning message is displayed as in the screenshot below<4}

trans-unit.source: {1>It also checks that the <1}{2>private TM key<2} you associated with your project is indeed {3>valid<3}.
trans-unit.target: {1>It also checks that the <1}{2>private TM key<2} you associated with your project is indeed {3>valid<3}.

trans-unit.source: You can use the {1>dustbin <1}icon to delete a file from the list of files to translate or click on the {2>Clear all <2}{3>button to delete all uploaded files from the list.<3}
trans-unit.target: You can use the {1>dustbin <1}icon to delete a file from the list of files to translate or click on the {2>Clear all <2}{3>button to delete all uploaded files from the list.<3}

trans-unit.source: Translation Memory and Machine Translation
trans-unit.target: Translation Memory and Machine Translation

trans-unit.source: Clicking on the {1>Options <1}button on the MateCat home page opens a window, as in the screenshot below:
trans-unit.target: Clicking on the {1>Options <1}button on the MateCat home page opens a window, as in the screenshot below:

trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 14
trans-unit.target: Page 14

trans-unit.source: {1>Here you can add and/or select <1}{2>additional options <2}to be added to the project you are creating.
trans-unit.target: {1>Here you can add and/or select <1}{2>additional options <2}to be added to the project you are creating.

trans-unit.source: For example, choose to get or not get machine translation suggestions from the MT server {3>MyMemory,<3} or {4>add or create a private TM<4}{5> for your project.<5}
trans-unit.target: For example, choose to get or not get machine translation suggestions from the MT server {3>MyMemory,<3} or {4>add or create a private TM<4}{5> for your project.<5}

trans-unit.source: {1}{2>For further details, refer to the <2}{3>Translation Toolbox<3}{4> section.<4}
trans-unit.target: {1}{2>For further details, refer to the <2}{3>Translation Toolbox<3}{4> section.<4}

trans-unit.source: Machine Translation Servers
trans-unit.target: Machine Translation Servers

trans-unit.source: In MateCat, the best option is to select {1>MyMemory <1}{2>which uses a combination of Google Translate and Microsoft Translator to provide machine translation suggestions.<2}
trans-unit.target: In MateCat, the best option is to select {1>MyMemory <1}{2>which uses a combination of Google Translate and Microsoft Translator to provide machine translation suggestions.<2}

trans-unit.source: {2>You can also disable machine translation, by selecting <2}{3>NONE <3}{4>from the dropdown menu.<4}
trans-unit.target: {2>You can also disable machine translation, by selecting <2}{3>NONE <3}{4>from the dropdown menu.<4}

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 15
trans-unit.target: Page 15

trans-unit.source: Analysis Report
trans-unit.target: Analysis Report

trans-unit.source: {1>During creation of the project, when all files have been uploaded and all information has been correctly set on the MateCat home page, the <1}{2>Analyze <2}button will be displayed.
trans-unit.target: {1>During creation of the project, when all files have been uploaded and all information has been correctly set on the MateCat home page, the <1}{2>Analyze <2}button will be displayed.

trans-unit.source: Click on the {3>Analyze <3}button to start the analysis.
trans-unit.target: Click on the {3>Analyze <3}button to start the analysis.

trans-unit.source: The analysis page will open.
trans-unit.target: The analysis page will open.

trans-unit.source: A progress bar shows you the progress on analyses of the files you uploaded for translation.
trans-unit.target: A progress bar shows you the progress on analyses of the files you uploaded for translation.

trans-unit.source: Once the analysis is completed, the volume analysis page displays the {1>Analysis report.<1}
trans-unit.target: Once the analysis is completed, the volume analysis page displays the {1>Analysis report.<1}

trans-unit.source: It contains information about the number of words ({2>Payable, Total, New, Repeated<2}) for the entire project and for each file/job.
trans-unit.target: It contains information about the number of words ({2>Payable, Total, New, Repeated<2}) for the entire project and for each file/job.

trans-unit.source: {1>Payable words <1}are marked in green and calculated by multiplying the words for each match type by the {2>payable percentage<2}:
trans-unit.target: {1>Payable words <1}are marked in green and calculated by multiplying the words for each match type by the {2>payable percentage<2}:

trans-unit.source: Assume you obtain the following analysis result:
trans-unit.target: Assume you obtain the following analysis result:

trans-unit.source: In detail, we have the indication of:
trans-unit.target: In detail, we have the indication of:

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 16
trans-unit.target: Page 16

trans-unit.source: {b>Payable words<b}
trans-unit.target: {b>Payable words<b}

trans-unit.source: Payable word count is the sum of the {1>weighted word count <1}for each match type multiplied by its {2>payable rate percentage<2}{3>.<3}
trans-unit.target: Payable word count is the sum of the {1>weighted word count <1}for each match type multiplied by its {2>payable rate percentage<2}{3>.<3}

trans-unit.source: {b>Total words<b}
trans-unit.target: {b>Total words<b}

trans-unit.source: The {1>total word count <1}{2>without leveraging any content from translation memory matches, repetitions or machine translation.<2}
trans-unit.target: The {1>total word count <1}{2>without leveraging any content from translation memory matches, repetitions or machine translation.<2}

trans-unit.source: {2>This is similar to what Microsoft Word would give as a word count in a .doc or .docx file.<2}
trans-unit.target: {2>This is similar to what Microsoft Word would give as a word count in a .doc or .docx file.<2}

trans-unit.source: {b>New words<b}
trans-unit.target: {b>New words<b}

trans-unit.source: All words found in segments that:
trans-unit.target: All words found in segments that:

trans-unit.source: • {1>do not match <1}{2>any fuzzy or complete match in the private TM Key and/or in the public TM;<2}
trans-unit.target: • {1>do not match <1}{2>any fuzzy or complete match in the private TM Key and/or in the public TM;<2}

trans-unit.source: • {1>are <1}{2>not repeated <2}{3>in the project;<3}
trans-unit.target: • {1>are <1}{2>not repeated <2}{3>in the project;<3}

trans-unit.source: • {1>do not have a suggestion <1}{2>from a machine translation.<2}
trans-unit.target: • {1>do not have a suggestion <1}{2>from a machine translation.<2}

trans-unit.source: {b>Repetitions<b}
trans-unit.target: {b>Repetitions<b}

trans-unit.source: Number of words of {1>identical <1}segments that occurs more than once throughout the project.
trans-unit.target: Number of words of {1>identical <1}segments that occurs more than once throughout the project.

trans-unit.source: For example, imagine that we find the following segments in our translation:
trans-unit.target: For example, imagine that we find the following segments in our translation:

trans-unit.source: My house is blue 2.
trans-unit.target: My house is blue 2.

trans-unit.source: My house is blue 3.
trans-unit.target: My house is blue 3.

trans-unit.source: My house is red
trans-unit.target: My house is red

trans-unit.source: Segments 1 and 2 are {1>identical segments, <1}so they are counted as 4 repetitions.
trans-unit.target: Segments 1 and 2 are {1>identical segments, <1}so they are counted as 4 repetitions.

trans-unit.source: Segment 3 is counted as an {1>internal match<1}.
trans-unit.target: Segment 3 is counted as an {1>internal match<1}.

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 17
trans-unit.target: Page 17

trans-unit.source: {b>Internal Matches<b}
trans-unit.target: {b>Internal Matches<b}

trans-unit.source: Internal matches are {1>similar segments <1}{2>found in the document you are translating.<2}
trans-unit.target: Internal matches are {1>similar segments <1}{2>found in the document you are translating.<2}

trans-unit.source: {2>For example, imagine that we find the following segments in our translation:<2}
trans-unit.target: {2>For example, imagine that we find the following segments in our translation:<2}

trans-unit.source: My house is blue 2.
trans-unit.target: My house is blue 2.

trans-unit.source: My house is red
trans-unit.target: My house is red

trans-unit.source: MateCat recognises that segment 2 is similar to segment 1 (3 words out of 4 are identical) so the following would occur during translation:
trans-unit.target: MateCat recognises that segment 2 is similar to segment 1 (3 words out of 4 are identical) so the following would occur during translation:

trans-unit.source: You translate segment 1
trans-unit.target: You translate segment 1

trans-unit.source: The translation memory is {1>updated <1}with this translation 3.
trans-unit.target: The translation memory is {1>updated <1}with this translation 3.

trans-unit.source: You open segment 2 for translation
trans-unit.target: You open segment 2 for translation

trans-unit.source: A search is performed in the TM for segment 2 and a {1>75% fuzzy match <1}is found.
trans-unit.target: A search is performed in the TM for segment 2 and a {1>75% fuzzy match <1}is found.

trans-unit.source: MateCat therefore counts four new words for segment 1 but, because a 75% fuzzy match has been found in the TM, the four words in segment 2 are counted as {1>Internal Matches <1}(in terms of weighted words, these are counted as 2.4, or 60% of 4).
trans-unit.target: MateCat therefore counts four new words for segment 1 but, because a 75% fuzzy match has been found in the TM, the four words in segment 2 are counted as {1>Internal Matches <1}(in terms of weighted words, these are counted as 2.4, or 60% of 4).

trans-unit.source: {b>Partial TM<b}
trans-unit.target: {b>Partial TM<b}

trans-unit.source: In this case, similarity between the document to be translated and any {1>correspondences found in the translation memory <1}{2>(fuzzy matches) are calculated.<2}
trans-unit.target: In this case, similarity between the document to be translated and any {1>correspondences found in the translation memory <1}{2>(fuzzy matches) are calculated.<2}

trans-unit.source: For example, imagine that we have following segments in an EN>FR translation:
trans-unit.target: For example, imagine that we have following segments in an EN>FR translation:

trans-unit.source: My house is blue 2.
trans-unit.target: My house is blue 2.

trans-unit.source: My house is red
trans-unit.target: My house is red

trans-unit.source: and that the TM contains this:
trans-unit.target: and that the TM contains this:

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 18
trans-unit.target: Page 18

trans-unit.source: Source
trans-unit.target: Source

trans-unit.source: Target
trans-unit.target: Target

trans-unit.source: My house is blue
trans-unit.target: My house is blue

trans-unit.source: Ma maison est bleue
trans-unit.target: Ma maison est bleue

trans-unit.source: For segment 1 (“My house is blue”), there will be a {1>100% match <1}in the translation memory.
trans-unit.target: For segment 1 (“My house is blue”), there will be a {1>100% match <1}in the translation memory.

trans-unit.source: For segment 2 (“My house is red”), there will be a {2>75% fuzzy match <2}(segment 2 and the segment found in the translation memory only differ in terms of the colour of the house: blue/red –bleue/rouge, so 1 word out of 4).
trans-unit.target: For segment 2 (“My house is red”), there will be a {2>75% fuzzy match <2}(segment 2 and the segment found in the translation memory only differ in terms of the colour of the house: blue/red –bleue/rouge, so 1 word out of 4).

trans-unit.source: This is a 100% match between a segment in the source language found in the document to translate and an {1>identical sentence <1}found in the source language in the translation memory.
trans-unit.target: This is a 100% match between a segment in the source language found in the document to translate and an {1>identical sentence <1}found in the source language in the translation memory.

trans-unit.source: {b>100% TM in context<b}
trans-unit.target: {b>100% TM in context<b}

trans-unit.source: This is {1>more than a 100% match<1}.
trans-unit.target: This is {1>more than a 100% match<1}.

trans-unit.source: {1>If you have a 100% context match (the corresponding label is “<1}{2>100% CM<2}”), this means that both of the following {3>2 conditions <3}exist:
trans-unit.target: {1>If you have a 100% context match (the corresponding label is “<1}{2>100% CM<2}”), this means that both of the following {3>2 conditions <3}exist:

trans-unit.source: • {1>the segment in the document has a <1}{2>100% match <2}{3>in the translation memory<3}
trans-unit.target: • {1>the segment in the document has a <1}{2>100% match <2}{3>in the translation memory<3}

trans-unit.source: • {1>the segment in the document and the segment in the translation memory must both be <1}{2>preceded by the same segment<2}
trans-unit.target: • {1>the segment in the document and the segment in the translation memory must both be <1}{2>preceded by the same segment<2}

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have to translate the following segments in the same order:
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have to translate the following segments in the same order:

trans-unit.source: My house is blue 2.
trans-unit.target: My house is blue 2.

trans-unit.source: My house is red
trans-unit.target: My house is red

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 19
trans-unit.target: Page 19

trans-unit.source: and you have a {1>100% match <1}{2>in the translation memory for segment 2, you will actually receive a <2}{3>100% CM <3}{4>if segment 2 is also preceded by segment 1 in the translation memory.<4}
trans-unit.target: and you have a {1>100% match <1}{2>in the translation memory for segment 2, you will actually receive a <2}{3>100% CM <3}{4>if segment 2 is also preceded by segment 1 in the translation memory.<4}

trans-unit.source: This means that you can be certain that the 100% match is correct according to the {1>context <1}{2>of the document you are translating.<2}
trans-unit.target: This means that you can be certain that the 100% match is correct according to the {1>context <1}{2>of the document you are translating.<2}

trans-unit.source: Actually this does not mean that, in the list of segments in the translation memory, the segment in the translation memory is indeed preceded by the same segment as the one in the document.
trans-unit.target: Actually this does not mean that, in the list of segments in the translation memory, the segment in the translation memory is indeed preceded by the same segment as the one in the document.

trans-unit.source: What it means is that {1>context information is stored in the translation memory as metadata<1}{2>, so each segment stored in the translation memory contains the following information (not visible in the translation memory contents by the users):<2}
trans-unit.target: What it means is that {1>context information is stored in the translation memory as metadata<1}{2>, so each segment stored in the translation memory contains the following information (not visible in the translation memory contents by the users):<2}

trans-unit.source: • {1>the source segment<1}
trans-unit.target: • {1>the source segment<1}

trans-unit.source: • {1>the corresponding translation<1}
trans-unit.target: • {1>the corresponding translation<1}

trans-unit.source: • {1>the segment preceding the segment itself.<1}
trans-unit.target: • {1>the segment preceding the segment itself.<1}

trans-unit.source: Click on the {1>Translate <1}button for each language pair to open the {2>Translation Editor<2} {3>window<3} and start translating.
trans-unit.target: Click on the {1>Translate <1}button for each language pair to open the {2>Translation Editor<2} {3>window<3} and start translating.

trans-unit.source: If you need to outsource it for translation to someone else, you should just send the {4>job URL <4}to your external resource.
trans-unit.target: If you need to outsource it for translation to someone else, you should just send the {4>job URL <4}to your external resource.

trans-unit.source: The URL is all you need to start translating.
trans-unit.target: The URL is all you need to start translating.

trans-unit.source: Public Translation Memory and Translation Memory Key
trans-unit.target: Public Translation Memory and Translation Memory Key

trans-unit.source: When translating, your translations are saved as bilingual sentences in a so-called {1>translation memory (TM), <1}{2>a sort of database containing bilingual segments (sentences, sets of words or single words already translated in one or more language pairs) which can be used during the translation of the same project or future projects.<2}
trans-unit.target: When translating, your translations are saved as bilingual sentences in a so-called {1>translation memory (TM), <1}{2>a sort of database containing bilingual segments (sentences, sets of words or single words already translated in one or more language pairs) which can be used during the translation of the same project or future projects.<2}

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 20
trans-unit.target: Page 20

trans-unit.source: So, when translating, if you find a segment that is identical or similar to another one that has already been translated, the translation memory suggests the wording of the already translated segment so that you can use it, partially or entirely, for translation of the new segment.
trans-unit.target: So, when translating, if you find a segment that is identical or similar to another one that has already been translated, the translation memory suggests the wording of the already translated segment so that you can use it, partially or entirely, for translation of the new segment.

trans-unit.source: In MateCat, you can save and store your translations:
trans-unit.target: In MateCat, you can save and store your translations:

trans-unit.source: • {1>in a <1}{2>generic public translation memory <2}{3>which can be accessed via API by all MateCat users.<3}
trans-unit.target: • {1>in a <1}{2>generic public translation memory <2}{3>which can be accessed via API by all MateCat users.<3}

trans-unit.source: • {1>in a new or already existing <1}{2>private TM assigned to one or more projects <2}{3>or to a specific client that enables you to save your translation in a private translation memory that <3}{4>cannot be accessed by external users.<4}
trans-unit.target: • {1>in a new or already existing <1}{2>private TM assigned to one or more projects <2}{3>or to a specific client that enables you to save your translation in a private translation memory that <3}{4>cannot be accessed by external users.<4}

trans-unit.source: In MateCat, each private TM is identified by a unique alphanumeric value called {1>private TM Key.<1}
trans-unit.target: In MateCat, each private TM is identified by a unique alphanumeric value called {1>private TM Key.<1}

trans-unit.source: {2>It is the only value you need in order to associate your TM(s) with your project.<2}
trans-unit.target: {2>It is the only value you need in order to associate your TM(s) with your project.<2}

trans-unit.source: {2>It is like a password to access your private TM in the MateCat Translation Memory server.<2}
trans-unit.target: {2>It is like a password to access your private TM in the MateCat Translation Memory server.<2}

trans-unit.source: If you save your translations in the private TM, they will be stored in your private translation memory only and you alone have {1>exclusive <1}{2>use of and access to your contributions to that private TM.<2}
trans-unit.target: If you save your translations in the private TM, they will be stored in your private translation memory only and you alone have {1>exclusive <1}{2>use of and access to your contributions to that private TM.<2}

trans-unit.source: {1>If you save your translations in the public TM, they can be viewed as suggestions by all MateCat users.<1}
trans-unit.target: {1>If you save your translations in the public TM, they can be viewed as suggestions by all MateCat users.<1}

trans-unit.source: {1>It would represent a <1}{2>human contribution to a public TM <2}and would help {3>other MateCat users <3}during their translation jobs in MateCat.
trans-unit.target: {1>It would represent a <1}{2>human contribution to a public TM <2}and would help {3>other MateCat users <3}during their translation jobs in MateCat.

trans-unit.source: TM backup and updates
trans-unit.target: TM backup and updates

trans-unit.source: Adding a private TM Key to your project means that the TM is {1>automatically updated during translation<1}{2>, if previously set.<2}
trans-unit.target: Adding a private TM Key to your project means that the TM is {1>automatically updated during translation<1}{2>, if previously set.<2}

trans-unit.source: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}
trans-unit.target: Release 1.4 | {1>{2>www.matecat.com <2}{3>| <3}<1}{4>info@matecat.com<4}

trans-unit.source: Page 21
trans-unit.target: Page 21

trans-unit.source: MateCat stores your TMs for you so that you do not need to {1>upload and download <1}the translated segments each time you translate.
trans-unit.target: MateCat stores your TMs for you so that you do not need to {1>upload and download <1}the translated segments each time you translate.

trans-unit.source: In this way, you have a {2>constant backup <2}{3>of your translation memory and you can use it again in the future by just storing the private TM key and associating it with a new project, typing it in again if needed.<3}{4>3<4}
trans-unit.target: In this way, you have a {2>constant backup <2}{3>of your translation memory and you can use it again in the future by just storing the private TM key and associating it with a new project, typing it in again if needed.<3}{4>3<4}

trans-unit.source: How to add a Glossary
trans-unit.target: How to add a Glossary

trans-unit.source: A glossary is a bilingual or multilingual database containing the translation of {1>terms<1}{2>4 <2}in a special subject, field or area of usage.
trans-unit.target: A glossary is a bilingual or multilingual database containing the translation of {1>terms<1}{2>4 <2}in a special subject, field or area of usage.

trans-unit.source: It is usually in Excel or CSV format and can help translators with the translations of {3>specific terms <3}{4>that can be translated in several ways depending on the subject matter.<4}
trans-unit.target: It is usually in Excel or CSV format and can help translators with the translations of {3>specific terms <3}{4>that can be translated in several ways depending on the subject matter.<4}
